page.title: 18Ecology - continued
page.content: In some woods the common Adder is often seen basking in the summer sunshine and cast skins are quite common. Small mammals such as field mice and voles exist in large numbers and there is much evidence of a large population of moles at work. Since Dutch Elm disease devastated the majority of Elms there has been extensive planting of saplings in hedges and fields, most of which are now well established. Many farms now have small areas which they leave undisturbed in order to encourage wildlife. Insects are numerous, moths and butterflies are prolific and many types of Dragon flies are resident around the ponds. Continued.
